com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.menu

Class NotifyingCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.menu.NotifyingCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class NotifyingCommand
extends Object
implements Command
    The class NotifyingCommand fires an event before the ClickHandler will be clicked.

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        public String getText()
        Specified by:
        getText in interface Command
        Returns:
        The text of the command which should be displayed in menu.
        Note: This text could contain &-symbols for themMnemonic char and double quoted (&&) symbols if & itself should be displayed.

      • getClickHandler

        public ClickHandler getClickHandler()
        Specified by:
        getClickHandler in interface Command
        Returns:
        The ClickHandler for the command. ClickHandler.onClick() should be called if the button or menu entry for this command is clicked.

      • getImageUrl

        public URL getImageUrl()
        Specified by:
        getImageUrl in interface Command
        Returns:
        The image url for this command. The image could be loaded by java resource loader. Many GUI-frameworks support methods for displaying images by url natively.

      • isShowText

        public boolean isShowText()
        Specified by:
        isShowText in interface Command
        Returns:
        true, if the text should be shown. Otherwise only the image should be shown. If your GUI does not support images you are able to display the text anyway.

      • getCommands

        public List<Command> getCommands()
        Specified by:
        getCommands in interface Command
        Returns:
        The sub commands. If you are displaying a Command you also have to display this sub-commands.

      • isBold

        public boolean isBold()
        Specified by:
        isBold in interface Command
        Returns:
        true, if the text of the command should be highlighted in some way. The easiest way is to display the text in bold letters.
        Note: Not all GUI-frameworks supports bold text in menus.

      • isIndented

        public boolean isIndented()
        Specified by:
        isIndented in interface Command
        Returns:
        true, if this command should be indented in some way. The simplest way to indent the command is to add spaces before the text.

      • getTextColor

        public MarkingColor getTextColor()
        Specified by:
        getTextColor in interface Command
        Returns:
        The color in which the text should be displayed. For different Flags the associated colors will be used.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Command
        Returns:
        true, if the user is allowed to execute the ClickHandler.

      • getToolTip

        public String getToolTip()
        Specified by:
        getToolTip in interface Command

      • getType

        public CommandType getType()
        Specified by:
        getType in interface Command
        Returns:
        The type of the command. This could be used to identify and filter or highlight special commands. Not every command has an own type. In this case CommandType.NULL will be used.

      • isChecked

        public boolean isChecked()
        Specified by:
        isChecked in interface Command
        Returns:
        true, if the button should stay in pressed mode. If a GUI-component has to support this option could be queried by Command.canBeChecked().

      • canBeChecked

        public boolean canBeChecked()
        Specified by:
        canBeChecked in interface Command
        Returns:
        true, if the command could be checked. This means the button could stay pressed. In some GUI-frameworks you have to use different buttons or menu entries for this kind of button. The state, if the button is pressed or not could be queried by Command.isChecked().
